text:
Maybe this talk is useful in pushing for programs without users and therefore implicitly rejecting the idea of software as a tool. I think this neatly sidesteps this meta issue. In this sense Realtalk for example doesn't have users, there's no dividing line between operating system, application and end-user interface. It comes down to the definition of 'liveness', and is the main fault line between (parts of the) live coding and future of coding-type communities.
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Z71KQtWpMk&t=7680s>
